label: Behavior 09879715
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 55.9123 - 0.0034 × t + 0.0002 × t², lon(t) ≈ 15.6514 + 0.0185 × t + 0.0006 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 15.1 and 15.3 knots across the trajectory)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG decreases slowly and consistently from 107.5° to 100.3°, indicating a smooth turn to the right over time)
Heading fluctuation: gradual and consistent (heading decreases gradually from 104.0° to 97.0°, closely tracking COG with small, stable differences)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 55.9123 - 0.0034 × t + 0.0002 × t², lon(t) ≈ 15.6514 + 0.0185 × t + 0.0006 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
